org.spongepowered.api.service.scheduler

Interface Task

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Identifiable

    public interface Task
extends Identifiable
    Represents a task that has been scheduled.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean cancel()
      Cancels the task.
      long getDelay()
      Gets the delay that the task was scheduled to run after.
      long getInterval()
      Gets the interval for repeating tasks.
      String getName()
      Gets the name of this task.
      PluginContainer getOwner()
      Returns the plugin that scheduled this task.
      Runnable getRunnable()
      Gets the Runnable that this task is running.
      boolean isAsynchronous()
      Gets whether this task is asynchronous.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.spongepowered.api.util.Identifiable

        getUniqueId

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Gets the name of this task.
        Returns:
        The name of the task

      • getOwner

        PluginContainer getOwner()
        Returns the plugin that scheduled this task.
        Returns:
        The plugin that scheduled the task

      • getDelay

        long getDelay()
        Gets the delay that the task was scheduled to run after. A delay of 0 represents that the task started immediately.
        Returns:
        The delay (offset) in either milliseconds or ticks (ticks are exclusive to synchronous tasks)

      • getInterval

        long getInterval()
        Gets the interval for repeating tasks. An interval of 0 represents that the task does not repeat.
        Returns:
        The interval (period) in either milliseconds or ticks (ticks are exclusive to synchronous tasks)

      • cancel

        boolean cancel()
        Cancels the task. Cancelling a repeating task will prevent any further repetitions of the task.
        Returns:
        If the task is not running and was cancelled

      • getRunnable

        Runnable getRunnable()
        Gets the Runnable that this task is running.
        Returns:
        The runnable

      • isAsynchronous

        boolean isAsynchronous()
        Gets whether this task is asynchronous.
        Returns:
        True if asynchronous, false if synchronous
